  • July 1, 2020

    Entry into Force of the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement Link: https://www.state.gov/entry-into-force-of-the-united-states-mexico-canada-agreement/

    On July 1, the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement came into force, fulfilling President Trump’s promise to modernize and update trade agreements.

  • July 1, 2020

    Issuance of Xinjiang Supply Chain Business Advisory Link: https://www.state.gov/issuance-of-xinjiang-supply-chain-business-advisory/

    The advisory highlights the risks for businesses with supply chain links to entities complicit in forced labor and other human rights abuses in Xinjiang and throughout China.

  • June 30, 2020

    Secretary Pompeo's Remarks at the UNSC on Iran Arms Embargo Link: https://www.state.gov/secretary-michael-r-pompeo-at-the-un-security-council-on-the-iran-arms-embargo/

    The United States’ overwhelming preference is to work with this council to extend the arms embargo to protect human life, to protect our national security, and to protect yours.

Michael R. Pompeo

United States

Secretary of State

@SecPompeo on Twitter Link: https://twitter.com/SecPompeo

  • About the Secretary Link: https://www.state.gov/secretary/
  • Latest Remarks Link: https://www.state.gov/speeches-secretary-pompeo/
  • The Secretary's travel Link: https://www.state.gov/travels-with-the-secretary-of-state/

62

Countries Visited

185

Travel Days

Mike Pompeo was sworn in as the 70th U.S. Secretary of State on April 26, 2018. The Secretary of State, appointed by the President with the advice and consent of the Senate, is the President's chief foreign affairs adviser. The Secretary carries out the President's foreign policies through the State Department, which includes the Foreign Service, Civil Service and U.S. Agency for International Development.

A New Transatlantic Dialogue Link: https://www.state.gov/a-new-transatlantic-dialogue/
